item.title: Imaginary problems are the root of bad software
item.description: - Imaginary problems can often be the root cause of bad software.

item.title: Swing VPN app is a DDoS botnet
item.description: - The Swing VPN app has been found to be a DDoS botnet, using its user base to launch distributed denial-of-service attacks on specific websites.

item.title: Sennheiser HD 555 to HD 595 Mod
item.description: - This post explains how to modify a pair of Sennheiser HD 555 headphones to have the same sound quality as the more expensive HD 595 headphones, saving $150.

item.title: Jellyfin: Free software media system
item.description: - Jellyfin is a free software media system that allows you to manage and stream your media.

item.title: I have received a $100k sponsorship for Ladybird browser
item.description: - The article discusses the receipt of a $100k sponsorship for the Ladybird browser.

item.title: A single line of code made a 24-core server slower than a laptop (2021)
item.description: - The performance of a benchmarking tool called Latte was unexpectedly slower on a 24-core server compared to a laptop, despite having more cores available.

item.title: Goodbye, Twilio
item.description: - The author is no longer an employee at Twilio after almost four years.

item.title: Follow up to "I booted Linux 293k times"
item.description: - The writer experienced a bug in Linux that caused the system to hang randomly, and decided to track down the issue.

item.title: Scientists create contained ball of turbulence in a tank
item.description: - Scientists at the University of Chicago have created a contained "ball" of turbulence in a tank of water, which has never been done before.

item.title: Infinite Photorealistic Worlds Using Procedural Generation
item.description: - 'The Tech Times' article discusses the concept of infinite photorealistic worlds created through procedural generation in the field of technology and gaming.
